subject: Marketing
title: Price Framing
description: A quick win: understand Price Framing.

hook.text: A $1,200 annual subscription sounds expensive. '$3.29 per day' sounds like a coffee.

buildup.text: Framing changes how the same number feels without changing the actual amount.

discovery.text: Per-day framing makes large prices feel tiny. Total framing makes small savings feel big.

twist.text: Charities use 'less than a cup of coffee' framing because it worksâ€”donations increase 30%.

climax.text: The frame is not decoration. It fundamentally changes the purchasing decision.

punchline.text: Same price, different frame, different decision.

quiz.question: Why does per-day framing increase willingness to pay?
options: It makes large prices feel comparable to small daily expenses
It actually reduces the total price charged
Consumers prefer daily billing over annual billing
